interlinear-text.item: Horkash Djorubov, 76 y.o. Vrang village. Recorded in 1965.

phrase.item: Little coral beads, one to the other
Every time I recall you
my tears flow like a river.
Little bird (white as) milk, from birch to birch
Every time I recall you from morning to night I shed tears.
Pheasant in Banicha
Every time I recall you (my) whole bosom is shredded.
Your long and thin eyebrows
When I wave ([my] hand) come back from the road
On your head is an embroidered headpiece.
Decided to leave and left. When you're fixing to leave, glance at me (at least once)!
Your headpiece has a red tassel.
Every time I recall you write me a letter/missive
Bronze are your stirrups
If your soul does not incline (to me) tell me straight!
I rose ever so high. When I look below mountains and dales have clothed in fall [colors].
Highest of heights
You, like a fire from a cattail (like) fire from a cattail, unfaithful/untrue.
The sun is in the zenith
Don't stay (too long) in foreign land divert/entertain your sweetheart!
High gates.
Whoever heads to the summer pasture tell mother, 'your daughter is sad'!
To be together - that is the essence Don't leave alone, you and I are friends forever.
Wind in the mountains.
Don't sigh (so) wearily, a heavy sigh [is] by the mountain
Little bird (white) like milk -
what a charming thing I shall insert you into a necklace, tie you round my neck.
A coquettish headpiece is on your head.
(Everything) that I shall suffer because of you is my lot [in life] and my fate.
Shawl (corner) over the shoulder.
I've conspired with you, (and) I'll insist on having my way.
